events.name: Apply to the Compost & Farm Apprenticeship with Earth Matter NY
events.type: Apply to the Compost & Farm Apprenticeship with Earth Matter NY
events.description: The free Compost & Farm Apprenticeship with Earth Matter NY offers GreenThumb gardeners the opportunity to work with Earth Matter NY and learn hands-on practical skills to grow plants on a small scale urban farm, with a focus on composting. You will learn how to make “Gold Standard” compost in a variety of urban environments. You will be engaging with a variety of composting procedures, devices and systems with the goal of utilizing best practices for the improvement of soil and plant health.Learn more and apply: bit.ly/EarthMatterSpring25 Deadline: Monday, February 17, at 11:59 p.m.Dates: 10 full-day Friday sessions from March 14 - May 16, 2025Location: Soil Start Farm, located on Governors Island.Eligibility:This training is for members of registered GreenThumb gardens (ages 18+) who are interested in growing their composting and vegetable production skills to the next level, acquiring green job skills, and spreading knowledge of composting best practices in New York City. We encourage gardeners to apply with another member from their garden. Both members still need to submit applications separately.
category: Apply to the Compost & Farm Apprenticeship with Earth Matter NY
tags: Apply to the Compost & Farm Apprenticeship with Earth Matter NY

events.description: Interval Walking Sessions consist of three segments: brisk, slow and a bodyweight exercise. Each segment is timed to improve cardiovascular health as well as increasing strength. Class will be cancelled if temperatures fall below 35°F.

venue.name: at Athletic Courts (in Torsney Playground), Queens

events.name: Arsenal Gallery: Brooklyn Dreamland, Land without Shadows
events.type: Arsenal Gallery: Brooklyn Dreamland, Land without Shadows
events.description: NYC Parks is pleased to present Brooklyn Dreamland, Land without Shadows, an exhibition of paintings and drawings by Christopher Spinelli depicting a bygone era of Coney Island on view at the Arsenal Gallery.In the late 1980s, Spinelli was encouraged by illustrator Robert Weaver to get out of the studio and explore real life. Childhood trips piled in his father's car in search of crinkle-cut fries led him to the B train, where he rode to the end of the line. Equipped with a sketch pad and Polaroid camera, Spinelli produced many drawings and images of the then-declining amusement site. Regarding these initial works, he states, "I began talking to the denizens of Coney Island, who were usually huddled in and around Nathan's for warmth; I drew them while they regaled me with their stories. Some of those first sketches are included in this exhibit." Inspired by buzzing neon signs and accumulated layers of peeling paint, Spinelli began producing the wonderfully garish acrylic works featured in this exhibition.Unlike his drawings, his paintings are rendered from childhood memory rather than present experience. He states, "My paintings of Coney Island are vibrantly colored and thickly textured; I am painting not as I found it, but what I remember seeing in those fleeting images from the back window of that Delta 88 as we drove by." This exhibition is FREE and open to the public. For more information, visit nyc.gov/parks/art. A public opening reception will be held on Thursday, January 23, 2025, at 6 p.m. Image Credit: Christopher Spinelli, This Way to the Spookarama, 2021, acrylic paint, 36”x48”
category: Arsenal Gallery: Brooklyn Dreamland, Land without Shadows
tags: Arsenal Gallery: Brooklyn Dreamland, Land without Shadows

venue.name: at Arsenal (in Central Park), Manhattan

events.description: Start your family's Mid-Winter Recess off with a walk through VCP with Van Cortlandt Park Alliance! In this free guided hike, families will hit the trails while learning about amazing local plants and animals, and how the park changes in the colder weather. Afterwards, (weather permitting) join us for a nature craft and themed activities! We'll be outside the whole time; dress appropriately for the weatherAll children must be accompanied by an adultRecommended for ages 3+.Strollers/bikes/scooters can be left at our garden space during the duration of our hikeFriendly and well-behaved pets on leashes are welcome! For any questions, please e-mail gardening@vancortlandt.org

events.description: NYC Parks is pleased to present Brooklyn Dreamland, Land without Shadows, an exhibition of paintings and drawings by Christopher Spinelli depicting a bygone era of Coney Island on view at the Arsenal Gallery.In the late 1980s, Spinelli was encouraged by illustrator Robert Weaver to get out of the studio and explore real life. Childhood trips piled in his father's car in search of crinkle-cut fries led him to the B train, where he rode to the end of the line. Equipped with a sketch pad and Polaroid camera, Spinelli produced many drawings and images of the then-declining amusement site. Regarding these initial works, he states, "I began talking to the denizens of Coney Island, who were usually huddled in and around Nathan's for warmth; I drew them while they regaled me with their stories. Some of those first sketches are included in this exhibit." Inspired by buzzing neon signs and accumulated layers of peeling paint, Spinelli began producing the wonderfully garish acrylic works featured in this exhibition.Unlike his drawings, his paintings are rendered from childhood memory rather than present experience. He states, "My paintings of Coney Island are vibrantly colored and thickly textured; I am painting not as I found it, but what I remember seeing in those fleeting images from the back window of that Delta 88 as we drove by." venue.name: at Dance Room (in Highbridge Recreation Center), Manhattan

events.name: Hart Island Tour (South Island)
events.description: Hart Island is the largest public cemetery in the country and has served New York City since 1869. Hart Island’s history is connected to many communities with important stories to tell. During the South Island Tour, Rangers will explore what Hart Island meant to the people who lived there, worked there, and were/are buried there. Walking the South Island includes discussion of an amusement park, military history, multiple pandemics, historic buildings and more. Join the Urban Park Rangers to hear their history and their voices.Participants are chosen by lottery. Lottery registration opens on Wednesday February 5, 2025 and ends Thursday February 6, 2025 at 11:59 p.m. Please Note:-You must register each member of your party for the lottery under the same account. Anyone who was not registered will not be permitted to attend.- If you are selected for the program, you will receive a series of emails confirming your selection and must respond as soon as possible to avoid forfeiting your spot. - Hart Island is only accessible via ferry. Selected participants will be provided details regarding program arrival and other specifics.- There are no indoor facilities, restrooms or drinking fountains on Hart Island. There are portable restrooms on the island.- This tour covers historical context of Hart Island and is about two hours of walking, some parts on uneven terrain. Please dress appropriately for the weather and the terrain.- Program may be cancelled due to inclement weather at the discretion of ferry operations.

venue.name: at Hart Island, Bronx
